title: Mexico’s Lopez Obrador denounces USAID funds as ‘interventionist’
description: The president issued a letter to his US counterpart Joe Biden, calling to halt funds to groups 'against' his government.

title: US halts food aid to Ethiopia’s Tigray, citing illicit sales
description: USAID head says shipments will resume to war-torn region in Ethiopia only after 'oversight measures are in place'.

title: What are the chances for peace in Sudan?
description: Warring generals invited to peace talks as they observe a week-long ceasefire

title: Pakistan beat New Zealand in third ODI cricket match
description: Pakistan wrap up five-match series after defeating New Zealand by 26 runs in the third one-day international in Karachi.

title: Press Freedom Day: US slammed over response to Abu Akleh killing
description: State Department official reiterates US is pressing Israel to 'review its policies' after Al Jazeera reporter's killing.

title: Rights commission says Peru crackdown may qualify as a ‘massacre’
description: A new report says that the killing of protesters amid widespread unrest may constitute 'extrajudicial executions'.

title: Former FBI agent charged in US Capitol attack
description: Video footage shows Jared Wise egging on protesters and comparing the Capitol police to 'Nazi' and 'Gestapo' officers.

title: US Fed hikes interest rates by 25bps, signals a pause
description: In face of recent bank failures & debt cap negotiations, US Fed said it will study economy, inflation in coming weeks.

title: US Senate launches latest legislative effort to take on China
description: Congressional push comes as US secretary of state says he will reschedule China visit cancelled over 'spy balloon' row.

title: What we know about the alleged drone attack on the Kremlin so far
description: Russia accused Ukraine of a failed attempt to assassinate Putin in a drone attack on Moscow's Kremlin citadel.

title: Haiti ‘dangling over an abyss’, UN human rights chief says
description: In address to UN Security Council, Volker Turk warns 'current lawlessness' in Caribbean nation requires urgent action.

title: Philadelphia 76ers star Joel Embiid wins first NBA MVP award
description: Nikola Jokic of the Denver Nuggets finished runner-up and Giannis Antetokounmpo of the Milwaukee Bucks was third.

title: Ukraine says 16 killed in Russian attack on Kherson
description: Strikes take place as local authorities announce a 58-hour curfew in the city starting on Friday.

title: Syria and Iran leaders sign long-term oil, trade agreements
description: The agreements were signed in Damascus to bolster economic ties between war-torn Syria and longtime ally Iran.

title: Icahn’s investment firm plunges, down 39% since Hindenburg report
description: Hindenburg has accused the company of overvaluing its holdings and relying on a "Ponzi-like" structure to pay dividends.

title: World Bank elects US nominee Ajay Banga president
description: He replaces Malpass, who was criticised for his stance on climate change and will step down nearly a year early.

title: The struggle against mega-basins is a struggle for life
description: From France to Chile, constructing water reservoirs for irrigation threatens communities and violates water rights.

title: We must do more to protect journalists globally
description: Over the past year, imprisonment of journalists and violence against media professionals have spiked.

title: Leeds United hire Sam Allardyce as manager after firing Gracia
description: Allardyce's last coaching role was at West Brom in 2020-21, when he failed to keep the team in the Premier League.

title: Barred from polls, a Greek neo-Nazi seeks way back to politics
description: Ex-Golden Dawn member Ilias Kasidiaris launches a party before the May 21 vote, but the Supreme Court disqualifies it.

title: German troops deployed to UN mission begin withdrawal from Mali
description: The German troops currently gather reconnaissance for the UN peacekeeping mission MINUSMA fighting armed groups in Mali.

title: Ronaldo becomes world’s best-paid athlete after Saudi move
description: PSG forward Lionel Messi was next on the Forbes list, while club teammate and France captain Kylian Mbappe was third.

title: Tunisia’s choice: Migration and realpolitik in the Mediterranean
description: Tunisia's relationship with Europe remains firm as the EU courts Tunis's help in stopping migration.

title: Putin ICC warrant debate goes on in South Africa: All the details
description: Many in government and opposition are united in proclaiming South Africa's reluctance to arrest Putin when he visits.

title: Clashes rock Sudan ceasefire as UN official seeks aid protection
description: Martin Griffiths, in visit to the country, seeks pledges from warring sides to allow movement of staff and supplies.

title: Brazilian police raid ex-President Bolsonaro’s home, seize phone
description: Jair Bolsonaro says 'surprised' by search, as police said they conducted 16 raids in probe into false COVID documents.

title: ‘State of terror’ hangs over Syrians in Lebanon amid deportations
description: Some 800,000 Syrian refugees are registered with the UNHCR after fleeing the civil war that began in 2011.

title: Iran seizes second oil tanker in a week amid US confrontation
description: US Navy says several Iranian vessels approached the tanker in the Strait of Hormuz and forced it into Iranian waters.

title: Why are journalists at risk in the Sahel?
description: Five journalists killed and six missing in last decade as conflict rises.

title: Israel discussing possible direct Hajj flights to Saudi Arabia
description: Israel's foreign minister says request submitted and "issue is under discussion".

title: ‘My dog works, too’: The 73-year-old vending on Lima’s streets
description: A vendor in Peru’s capital and his cocker spaniel find ‘life’ on the city's streets as they work hard to earn a living.

title: Port Sudan, a Red Sea refuge for many fleeing Sudan’s violence
description: People fleeing Khartoum are finding respite in Port Sudan – whether they ultimately choose to leave Sudan or stay.

title: Russia accuses Ukraine of attempted drone attack on Kremlin
description: Alleged assault in Moscow seen as an attempt on Putin's life, state media reports.

title: Senegal: Widows of the Sea
description: Senegalese women reflect on the loss of their menfolk, feared dead after attempting the 1,500km boat journey to Europe.

title: Western countries pile pressure on Mali over Wagner presence
description: Questions are raised at a UN human rights meeting about the role of the Russian private military contractor

title: Map: What is the state of press freedom in the world today?
description: To mark World Press Freedom Day, Al Jazeera looks at where the media is most restricted around the globe.

title: British Asians reflect on Empire before King Charles’s coronation
description: Decades after the end of the British Empire, many South Asian Britons are still grappling with the monarchical legacy.

title: Delhi’s Coronation Park a neglected site of India’s colonial past
description: Visitors to sprawling site meant as memorial to British rule in the subcontinent get no help in understanding the space.

title: Gaza truce holds as Palestinians protest death of hunger striker
description: Israeli forces demolish Palestinian homes in the occupied West Bank as more rallies planned after death of Khader Adnan.

title: Pakistan government, Imran Khan’s PTI agree on simultaneous polls
description: Late-night talks between the ruling alliance and Khan's PTI party however end without any agreement on a poll date.

title: UN: 258 million people faced acute food insecurity in 2022
description: Report finds number of people facing acute food insecurity and requiring urgent food aid increased for a fourth year.

title: Let us have a proper discussion about child sexual abuse
description: Turning this important issue into a matter of colour and ethnicity could allow predators to avoid detection.

title: Anti-mafia raids lead to more than 100 arrests across Europe
description: An operation against the Italian 'Ndrangheta mafia takes place in Germany, Belgium, France, Italy, Portugal and Spain.

title: Photos: Crowds of those seeking rescue swell at Sudan’s seaport
description: Fighting has displaced at least 334,000 people inside Sudan and sent tens of thousands more to neighbouring countries.

title: Belarusian activist Protasevich sentenced to eight years in jail
description: Accusations against the 27-year-old included organising mass riots and calling for sanctions against Belarus.

title: School shooting kills one, injures five in Serbia’s Belgrade
description: A 14-year-old boy is arrested and accused of using his father's gun to kill a security guard and injure five students.

title: Iran’s Raisi in Syria; visit hailed as ‘strategic victory’
description: President's deputy says it also represents a failure of US policies in the region.

title: Sierra Leone ratifies candidacy of president, opposition leader
description: President Julius Maada Bio and opposition leader Samura Kamara also contested in the 2018 elections.

title: India, Brazil among most dangerous places for activists: Report
description: Business & Human Rights Resource Centre says it recorded more than 550 attacks on human rights defenders in 2022.

title: UK, Norway scramble fighter jets to track Russia patrol plane
description: Typhoon jets take off from the UK and Norwegian F-35As are also scrambled in a NATO response to the Russian aircraft.

title: At least 55 killed in Rwanda flash floods
description: Rwanda is expected to receive above-average rainfall in May.

title: Child marriage rate falling too slowly, UN says in new report
description: UNICEF estimates that some 640 million girls and women today were married when they were below 18.

title: Sudan fighting in its 19th day: A list of key events
description: Sudan's warring military factions agreed to a new and longer seven-day ceasefire from Thursday.

title: Could an old tribal foe undercut Sudan’s Hemedti?
description: The RSF could be more vulnerable in its stronghold in Darfur, where a rival foe is challenging Hemedti.

title: Myanmar to free more than 2,000 political dissidents
description: Military, which has used force to stamp out opposition to its rule, says amnesty is for 'humanitarian' reasons.

title: US police capture suspect in killing of 5 neighbours in Texas
description: Francisco Oropesa, 38, is suspected of shooting dead five neighbours aged between eight and 31.

title: Russian defence minister calls for missile production to double
description: Russia launched a drone attack on Kyiv overnight on Tuesday, though all drones were shot down, Ukrainian officials say.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 434
description: As the war enters its 434th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: US on track to open new Tonga embassy this month
description: The US has been deepening engagement in the Pacific region amid concerns about China's influence.

title: First Republic rescue fails to calm market turmoil
description: Regional bank shares suffer double-digit losses despite JPMorgan Chase's acquisition of troubled lender.

title: China’s foreign minister touts ‘friendship’ on Myanmar visit
description: Qin Gang is the highest-ranking Chinese official to meet Myanmar's Min Aung Hlaing since his power grab two years ago.

title: Messi to face disciplinary action at PSG over Saudi Arabia trip
description: Football superstar Messi may face suspension for taking a trip to Saudi Arabia without permission from PSG: News reports

title: Beyond barbed wire: South Korea invites public to hike DMZ
description: New trails, currently open only to Koreans for security reasons, provide a new perspective on heavily-fortified border.

title: IBM to freeze hiring as CEO expects AI to replace 7,800 jobs
description: CEO Arvind Krishna says 30 percent of non-customer-facing roles could be axed in the next five years.

title: Hong Kong reduces directly-elected seats in district polls
description: The latest changes are part of an effort to ensure only 'patriots' hold political office in the territory.

title: Hong Kong court considers journalist appeal on press freedom day
description: Bao Choy is appealing her conviction over her investigation into a brutal mob attack at the Yuen Long station in 2019.

title: Palestinian groups, Israeli forces agree to Gaza truce: Report
description: Israeli forces and armed Palestinian groups in Gaza have agreed to a 'reciprocal and simultaneous' ceasefire: Reuters.

title: Amid protests, authorities uphold legitimacy of Paraguay election
description: The Organization of American States, as well as Paraguay officials, have affirmed the legitimacy of Sunday's vote.
